    • Using plyranges like bedtools

Disjoin then aggregate a Ranges object

Disjoin then aggregate a Ranges object

disjoin_ranges(.data, ...)

disjoin_ranges_directed(.data, ...)

Arguments

.data

a Ranges object to disjoin
...

Name-value pairs of summary functions.

Value

a Ranges object with the

Examples

df <- data.frame(start = 1:10, width = 5,  seqnames = "seq1",
strand = sample(c("+", "-", "*"), 10, replace = TRUE), gc = runif(10))
rng <- as_granges(df)
rng %>% disjoin_ranges()
#> GRanges object with 14 ranges and 0 metadata columns:
#>        seqnames    ranges strand
#>           <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle>
#>    [1]     seq1    [1, 1]      *
#>    [2]     seq1    [2, 2]      *
#>    [3]     seq1    [3, 3]      *
#>    [4]     seq1    [4, 4]      *
#>    [5]     seq1    [5, 5]      *
#>    ...      ...       ...    ...
#>   [10]     seq1  [10, 10]      *
#>   [11]     seq1  [11, 11]      *
#>   [12]     seq1  [12, 12]      *
#>   [13]     seq1  [13, 13]      *
#>   [14]     seq1  [14, 14]      *
#>   -------
#>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths
rng %>% disjoin_ranges(gc = mean(gc))
#> GRanges object with 14 ranges and 1 metadata column:
#>        seqnames    ranges strand |                gc
#>           <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> |         <numeric>
#>    [1]     seq1    [1, 1]      * | 0.330529848113656
#>    [2]     seq1    [2, 2]      * | 0.264604459167458
#>    [3]     seq1    [3, 3]      * |  0.25496774011602
#>    [4]     seq1    [4, 4]      * | 0.259947470156476
#>    [5]     seq1    [5, 5]      * |  0.32622218686156
#>    ...      ...       ...    ... .               ...
#>   [10]     seq1  [10, 10]      * | 0.283153523877263
#>   [11]     seq1  [11, 11]      * | 0.290594241407234
#>   [12]     seq1  [12, 12]      * | 0.346296578412876
#>   [13]     seq1  [13, 13]      * | 0.404491924098693
#>   [14]     seq1  [14, 14]      * | 0.211408555973321
#>   -------
#>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths
rng %>% disjoin_ranges_directed(gc = mean(gc))
#> GRanges object with 14 ranges and 1 metadata column:
#>        seqnames    ranges strand |                gc
#>           <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> |         <numeric>
#>    [1]     seq1  [ 1,  5]      + | 0.330529848113656
#>    [2]     seq1  [ 9,  9]      + | 0.597575292224064
#>    [3]     seq1  [10, 13]      + | 0.404491924098693
#>    [4]     seq1  [14, 14]      + | 0.211408555973321
#>    [5]     seq1  [ 5,  5]      - | 0.591321053681895
#>    ...      ...       ...    ... .               ...
#>   [10]     seq1  [ 4,  6]      * | 0.236420010837416
#>   [11]     seq1  [ 7,  7]      * | 0.211356064227099
#>   [12]     seq1  [ 8,  8]      * | 0.209426592569798
#>   [13]     seq1  [ 9, 11]      * | 0.176696558715776
#>   [14]     seq1  [12, 12]      * | 0.229905887041241
#>   -------
#>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths
